intro: Cynanchum parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which is characterized by its milky sap and showy flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, linear leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. Its root system is deep and fibrous, allowing it to thrive in poor soils and withstand drought conditions. Cynanchum parviflorum is also noted for its medicinal properties, with various parts of the plant used in traditional remedies.
